CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 3 (substantive aspect);Violation of Art. 5-1;Violation of Art. 5-3;Violation of Art. 5-4;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Ganna Yudkivska;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Julia Laffranque;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor of the Vatutinsky District of GPE ( “ the LOC Prosecutor ” ) instituted proceedings with regard to embezzlement of funds of the company NORP The applicant was originally a witness in the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Vatutinsky District Prosecutor instituted criminal proceedings against the applicant on suspicion of his involvement in the embezzlement .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Vatutinsky District Prosecutor decided that the applicant should be detained , as he was suspected of a crime punishable by imprisonment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator instituted another criminal case against the applicant on suspicion of his involvement in embezzlement and joined it to the first criminal case against the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the same prosecutor decided that the applicant 's detention should be extended to DATE .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE and on DATE the applicant and his lawyer studied the criminal case file .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was indicted for theft .
CARDINAL . On DATE the indictment was approved by ORG . The case was transferred for examination on its merits to LOC ( “ the Vatutinsky Court ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's advocate lodged a request with ORG seeking the applicant 's immediate release .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG received the case file and on DATE Judge PERSON of ORG held a preparatory hearing in the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE Judge PERSON decided that the criminal case against the applicant should be remitted for additional investigation . He also rejected the applicant 's request for release of CARDINAL DATE , finding no grounds for changing the preventive measure applied by the prosecutor . In particular , the court stated that the applicant had been detained on the basis of the prosecutor 's decision since DATE in order to prevent him from avoiding investigation and appearance in court , obstructing the establishment of the truth in the criminal case and continuing with criminal activity , and in order to ensure compliance with procedural decisions in cases where the law provides for deprivation of liberty for DATE . No time - limit for detention was fixed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the Court of Appeal ” ) quashed the resolution of DATE and remitted the case for examination on the merits to GPE , GPE ( formerly LOC , but after changes to the judicial districts in GPE “ the ORG ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a preparatory hearing in the case . It examined the applicant 's request to be released on bail and found no reasons for allowing it . It also noted that the applicant had been detained lawfully , given that criminal proceedings against him were pending .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's lawyer requested ORG to order the applicant 's release . This request was refused DATE . The court considered that the applicant might evade and obstruct justice and , given his age , state of health , family status and economic status there were no grounds for replacing the detention with another preventive measure . On DATE the court rejected a similar request by the applicant on the same grounds , adding that the seriousness of the charges had also been taken into account . CARDINAL more similar requests by the applicant were rejected by the court on CARDINAL and DATE on the same grounds .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered that the case be again remitted for additional investigation . The court also upheld the applicant 's detention , noting without further elaboration that there were no grounds for changing the preventive measure . No time - limit for detention was fixed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the resolution and remitted the case for re - examination on the merits . The court also noted that it had no legal basis for deciding on the applicant 's request for release and considered that the conclusions of the first - instance court on the matter were lawful , reasoned and corresponded to the case file materials . Therefore , it left the preventive measure unchanged .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE ORG ordered the transfer of the criminal case from ORG to ORG of Kyiv ( “ the ORG ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered a hearing on the merits on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE Judge PERSON resumed examination of the case on the merits and informed the applicant 's lawyer that she had decided not to remit the case for additional investigation . The court also rejected the applicant 's request for release , on the ground that he might avoid and obstruct justice .
CARDINAL . On DATE the defence challenged Judge C.

CARDINAL . On DATE Judge C. of ORG decided to remit the case for additional investigation . It also decided that there were no grounds for changing the preventive measure in respect of the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE and returned the case to ORG for examination on the merits . It also decided again that the applicant should remain in custody , as he had been charged with serious offences which would warrant deprivation of liberty after conviction .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG decided that the case should be remitted for additional investigation to LOC . It also ordered the applicant 's continued detention , without giving any particular reasons for it . The court also rejected the applicant 's request for termination of the proceedings in the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's request for leave to appeal on points of law lodged against the decision not to terminate the proceedings , as the applicant had failed to comply with procedural formalities .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Desnyansky ORG released the applicant from detention . The applicant signed an undertaking not to abscond .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's advocate unsuccessfully requested the prosecution to amnesty the applicant , in view of the nature of the charges brought against him and his poor state of health .
CARDINAL . On DATE the criminal investigation was adjourned because CARDINAL of the suspects was being searched for .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator of ORG terminated the criminal proceedings against the applicant on all but CARDINAL of the charges , for lack of evidence of his involvement in the crime . The criminal case concerning the remaining charges was transferred to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator of ORG terminated the criminal proceedings against the applicant concerning the remaining charges for lack of evidence of crime and initiated criminal proceedings in respect of crimes committed by an unknown person . This decision appears to have been mistakenly dated DATE instead of DATE . DATE the criminal proceedings were suspended for failure to establish the identity of the suspected offender .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the applicant was held in the GPE no . CARDINAL , a detention facility with , according to the applicant , poor prison conditions and insufficient medical treatment .
CARDINAL . According to the Government , in that facility the applicant was held in the following cells :
- cell No . CARDINAL , measuring QUANTITY and designed for CARDINAL inmates ;

All the cells had a constant supply of cold water , natural and artificial light , a separated toilet and ventilation . The number of detainees did not exceed the number of places in each cell .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , he was not held in cells CARDINAL and CARDINAL . Cells CARDINAL , CARDINAL and DATE had CARDINAL bunks each . Cell CARDINAL , measuring QUANTITY m , was damp and very cold in DATE . In this latter cell he spent in total DATE . In cell no . CARDINAL , which had very poor ventilation , he spent DATE in total .

CARDINAL . According to the ORG , the applicant had a full medical examination on arrival at the GPE on DATE . He did not make any complaints about his health and was registered for follow - up ( диспансерний облік ) in respect of his chronic illnesses .
CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE and DATE the applicant had regular medical check - ups and was X - rayed . The examination revealed no lung problems .
CARDINAL . According to a medical certificate issued on DATE , the applicant had a mild form of diabetes and required a special diet but not medical treatment .
CARDINAL . According to a medical certificate issued on DATE the applicant had been diagnosed with ischaemic heart disease , stenocardia and diabetes .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by a cardiologist , who found him to be suffering from ischaemic heart disease and stenocardia .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked for medical assistance , complaining of chest pain and dizziness . Following a medical examination it was decided to place the applicant in the medical wing of the GPE . From DATE the applicant was treated in the medical wing of the GPE , with a diagnosis of neurocirculatory dystonia and cervical osteochondrosis . The applicant was prescribed several different types of medication . Every third day he was examined by a general doctor . On DATE he was examined by the cardiologist who found that the applicant had no heart problems . On DATE the applicant was examined by a neuropathologist . On DATE the applicant left the medical wing of the ORG in a satisfactory state of health . Following this treatment , and until his release from detention , the applicant did not consult doctors with any health - related complaints .
CARDINAL . Following his release , the applicant underwent medical treatment in ORG no . CARDINAL for arrhythmogenic cardiomyopathy and ciliary arrhythmia from DATE .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW provides that having decided to commit an accused for trial , the judge should resolve , among other things the issue concerning the change , discontinuation or application of a preventive measure . Other relevant domestic law is summarised in the judgments of GPE v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINALII ( extracts ) ) , and PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , DATE ) .
